website_summaries.verdict: Knife owners who seek color options other than the usual olive or matte black may like this. We like the lighter weight that does not sacrifice blade length.
pros: Wide range of handle colors available
Blade is extremely sharp, holds edge well
cons: Blade is very thin and can snap under pressure

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again if lost or stolen.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Spyderco. It took me about ten minutes to fall in love. Probably one of the best steels I've had in a knife, but I'm still putting it through its initial testing phase. Carries so comfortably that you forget it's there. Superb design and versatility. I honestly think the knife looks goofy, but it is growing on me a little. My biggest complaint would be that, as far as I'm aware, it isn't possible to get this blade with the black coating unless you go half-serrated. So far, it has been a wonderful EDC and I can see why this is one of their best selling knives. Well done Spyderco.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Craig Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Great pocketknife.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. I owned one of the early Endura's and it held up really well so I bought another. Seems like the quality is still up there. Very sharp out of the box, holds an edge well, and opening/unlocking are easy. I would probably want something with a thicker, cheaper blade if I was sawing away at stuff every day with it, but for occasional around the house use it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Delica4's Big  Bad Bro
customer_reviews.text: Carries like a much smaller knife. Unbelievably light for its size. Excellent build quality. The scales feel just a little rough to me but that might be good thing. I chose green for better visibility and because it looks less threatening than black. A finger choil would be useful. There are more affordable knives with comparable quality, but after 50+ years of mostly junk knives & tools I decided to splurge on some quality. Some people collect spyderco knives like baseball cards(they never use them) but mine gets put to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Harold J

customer_reviews.title: Spyderco Endura4 FFG folder for 2013
customer_reviews.text: The Spyderco Endura4 folder is a quality knife, good design, VG-10 steel and lightweight. It is so lightweight it is good for EDC however it seems somewhat weak for big chores. The Kabar Mule folder is a more substantial folder and seems to be stronger but heavier. Also there is no case/sheath provided but it does have a good clip for pocket carry. This is basically a utility knife not a tactical knife. The full flat grind is often mislabeled as a saber grind in descriptions. One hand open works well. Traction on the scales is bidirectional and very good. Available in many colors. The price is a little high in comparison with other folders.
customer_reviews.author: scotts

customer_reviews.title: I love them! Light weight and cheap enough to beat ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about 5 of these knives and keep them in various places. I love them! Light weight and cheap enough to beat on, they are a great value oriented knife.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Fine knife
customer_reviews.text: For the price I've never seen a better blade. Its on the top 5 for my knives, with very good utility. The vg-10 steel holds an impressive edge while not being hard to sharpen, and has great corrosion resistant properties. The handle isn't much to look at but it gets the job done. (this is a lightweight version with the fiberglass reinforced nylon, however the handle is skeletonized with more steel. I think anyone who buys one will have a reliable pal for quite a few years. This one is from Japan not China if that makes anyone feel better. :)
customer_reviews.author: StormyGloom

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: Great moderately priced knife. Has held its edge well despite what I've cut with it. Easy to open with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorite Knives
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife so much, I bought it in green and brown. The full flat grind VG-10 blade slices cleanly through newspaper right out of the box. The large thumb-hole and solid back lock make it fun to flip open. I like a larger blade, and the proportions give this one an elegant, interesting look. Although the handle is a bit narrow for a solid grip, it's so thin it practically disappears in your pocket. The texturing on the handle looks kind of like armadillo hide. I won't spend over $60 on a knife unless it's unique, practical, and high quality. This one fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. WatersTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Great blade for EDC and heavy utility.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for another of the same type, and I couldn't be happier with it. It arrived sharper than the last one I ordered (from another vendor) and the clip was extremely secure. After EDC for a few weeks, it hasn't loosened at all so far. After using it to cut open cardboard and through data cables for a couple weeks, the blade is still just as sharp as it was on day one. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Sebring

customer_reviews.title: perfection from Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: Perfect design. I took mine apart fully as soon as I got it (might void warranty, I dunno), clean it and relube the pivot and bushings with a good lube (I use nano oil), and then set the pivot screw so that I can easily flick out the blade. This is not legal advice, and I don't know if any of that will make you liable criminally or void your warranty or whatever, so don't sue me.
customer_reviews.author: G_to-the_D

customer_reviews.title: Best knife ever?
customer_reviews.text: Among my favorite knives ever!!! I love this knife for a daily farm carry knife. It fits in the hand wonderfully, opens super fast, and comes sharp as hell.
customer_reviews.author: nat

customer_reviews.title: Best knife I own
customer_reviews.text: I am not a knife connoisseur. I don't own very many knives. I did a lot of research before buying this folder. This full flat ground (FFG) is the sharpest knife own by far - the VG10 steel produces an easy to maintain edge. I just hit the due with my leather stropblock every now and then to keep it razor, and I mean hair whittling, sharp. The folder has such a thin profile that you hardly know it is in your pocket. I plan to buy two more to give to my sons on their birthdays.
customer_reviews.author: John Saf

customer_reviews.title: You should probably buy it
customer_reviews.text: Good knife, good value. VG-10 seems to be a very good blade steel, not a "super steel" but it does hold an edge noticeably longer than 440c, AUS8, 8cr13mov, etc. I would compare it very closely to Benchmade's 154cm. Handle Material is very tough, yeah it's not fancy but the fancy stuff costs more money and isn't any more functional. Lock up is good, it is very possible to close with one hand safely, and honestly if you need stronger than this just get a fixed blade. Colors are cool. You should probably buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great steel, great liners, great knife
customer_reviews.text: This is my EDC, it's a little large for that purpose, maybe I should've purchased the Delica instead. In my opinion the factory edge though sharp, is a little obtuse. I reprofiled it on a 220, 1000, 5000 water stone progression. It cuts very well and the steel is phenomenal. One of my favorite stain resistant steels.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Not a bottle opener!
customer_reviews.text: With many other folders I've used the spine to open bottle caps.. but Danger Will Robinson!! Do not use this knife to do so... I tried it right out of the box and took a big chunk of my skin off... Yes it's sharp as hell.. amazing FRN handle with great grip texture.. strong clip.. great for edc.. but the blade shape has a learning curve..
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Love the handle
customer_reviews.text: Nicest knife I've ever owned. Straight razor sharp out of the box. Love the handle. The first time I sliced a package open, it was like in a movie - I literally didn't feel any resistance as it cut through 12 inches of plastic. Anybody and everybody should be pleased with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Spurs

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: What can you say, spyderco makes a scary sharp knife that's easy to use and sharpen. The vg10 makes this one simpler to sharpen than the zdp models, and trust me, it's sharp enough for what you have in mind.
customer_reviews.author: AmaNerd

customer_reviews.title: ordered the endura and it was just to big for ...
customer_reviews.text: ordered the endura and it was just to big for me, i am average person and for me it is too big to be EDC maybe for outdoor etc
customer_reviews.author: avi

customer_reviews.title: Seki City steel rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this knife. Some people say it's too big for EDC, but it's so light I don't notice it in my pocket at all. The VG-10 steel cuts like butter. The Japanese folks that make it know what they are doing. Check out this or the Delica for something a bit smaller. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Burnside Bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Excellent knife.Nice sharp edge. Just what you would expect from Spyderco
customer_reviews.author: mcornett56

customer_reviews.title: Spyderco always delivers good quality, good product
customer_reviews.text: Spyderco always delivers good quality, good product, and reliability in their knives. This came on time and was absolutely razor-sharp right out of box. This is my new EDC knife that I use a lot of work so I have to depend on their product, so far it's worked out pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: thx1138

customer_reviews.title: I use it for EDC the blade is a bit long but it's great for when a restaurant gives you a dud knife ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this Endura4, I use it for EDC the blade is a bit long but it's great for when a restaurant gives you a dud knife and the length is great for not getting gunk in the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Spyderco quality does it again. I have owned a few versions of Enduras over the years and they keep improving them. This one with choice of color, Flat ground, non-serrated blade is great. Came out of the box shaving sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, perfect size for a large hand and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, perfect size for a large hand and blade is sharp for any task. The handle does seem a bit cheap made of plastic but time will tell how it holds up. Easy to open with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Hikmer

customer_reviews.title: Comes with matching trainer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the FRN and the matching trainer. Very glad I did. The Endura4 FRN is a serious knife for personal defense. The trainer will install muscle memory for working with the live blade. Without the trainer, you WILL injure yourself. Thank you Spyderco for offering a trainer. Most manufacturers don't.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Not a heavy duty blade but that's not what your ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a heavy duty blade but that's not what your buying. It works perfectly in an edc role just mind the blade length.
customer_reviews.author: David lopez

customer_reviews.title: Light and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This all you will ever need from a knife. It's big yet light and packs a punch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A folding legend!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is amazing. Comfortable, super sharp Japanese VG-10 steel, high quality construction, stylish (Mine came in green). What more do you need? Spyderco is a great company that makes high quality knives and stand by their product. Perfect for EDC. Get one and don't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Metalstrike

customer_reviews.title: great knife, a bit bigger than I was thinking
customer_reviews.text: great knife, a bit bigger than I was thinking. Use as everyday carry except work. ( because of size ) 10/10 would buy
customer_reviews.author: Cullen Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carry Knife
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and extremely sharp. Personally I find it can be deployed extremely fast with a little practice. Almost as fast as my SOGs with SAT (Spring Assisted Technology).
customer_reviews.author: colt

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Love the flat grind...seems practical. Big knife but light. Seems very sturdy, and the lock, as with all Spyderco knives, is rock solid. Can't go wrong with Spyderco
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Seems to hold a pretty good edge
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp out of the box. Seems to hold a pretty good edge. I haven't really put it though the ringer yet though.
customer_reviews.author: AlliSw22

customer_reviews.title: Plain Edge Knife
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was just right & it got here fast!! The knife is very lightweight & a vibrant green color, with a textured grip for easy handling.
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: My LOVE!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: That was my first pocket knife and I am glad to be a Spyderco Endura 4 owner, beacuse this knife in my opinion is the best ever made by Spyderco. That is light and easily to carry in pocket, very sharp and the VG10 is very strong. I do recommend this knife for EDC.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: this knife is a badass!
customer_reviews.text: this blade came razor sharp out the box!still not dull and i use it every day of the week at work!the handle scales really keep a grip no matter how you hold it!the lock is stong has yet to fail me,and the deployment is fast,really fast when you put the ziptie around the hole cause aint nobody got time for that!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 0 rust clean and crisp locking mechanism. I'll buy it again if I lose it!
customer_reviews.author: RYan

customer_reviews.title: Top quality - just what one has come to expect from Spyderco.
customer_reviews.text: This knife was razor sharp right out of the box, as are most Spyderco products. I have rarely been disappointed by any of the products in the Spyderco line. This knife is lightweight, yet strong, and is made in Seki City, Japan - long known as a center for the production of high-quality cutlery.
customer_reviews.author: maddog

customer_reviews.title: Best knife I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this knife! I didn't even know how dull my other knives were until I had this to compare. I really hope that this is the first of many Spyderco knives for me. I already have my eye on the Military, Para Military, Police 3, and Civilian.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: This knife feels like its delica counter part in terms of weight
customer_reviews.text: This knife feels like its delica counter part in terms of weight. The only difference is that it takes up more space in the pocket. Again, razor sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome knife and is now my edc. Sharp blade holds an edge well. Feels comfortable in my hand. I really dig the unique Spyderco blade design. I would definentely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Adam

customer_reviews.title: Love it. The weight
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The weight, length, texture, steel, design and color has been working out well for me. Very unobtrusive yet handy.
customer_reviews.author: clay

customer_reviews.title: excellent knife.
customer_reviews.text: excellent knife..very light weight and feels great with a nice grip..big blade to..first time owning a spyderco knife and i must say its the best knife i have owned so far..Thanks amazon and spyderco
customer_reviews.author: J.M

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Knife!
customer_reviews.text: My first Spyderco. Beautiful fit and finish. You can feel the quality. Razor sharp. Worth every cent. Planning another Spyderco purchase, possibly the Manix 2 in translucent blue for EDC and SD.
customer_reviews.author: I DEW

customer_reviews.title: My favorite EDC knife so far
customer_reviews.text: My favorite EDC knife so far. Love the thin and light weight design. One of the most beautiful blades. Solid lockup and love the colors. Pocket clip is done just right. Cant ask for more. Now my Benchmades stay in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife. Going to be in my rotation for ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife. Going to be in my rotation for a while.
customer_reviews.author: James Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great edc knife, light weight, grippy handle, awesome blade shape and blade steel, fantastic gimping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hipe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its not a piece of magic if thats what your expecting just quality materials with quality specs. I love mine beauty and value is in the eyes of the beholder . I feel it is truely beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife, quality is superb
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife, quality is superb, a little bit big for edc taste but the vg10 holds a very nice edge, lock up is solid no play at all. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Jacob moon

customer_reviews.title: big and razor sharp cant ask for more
customer_reviews.text: light weight sturdy lock up, cant really ask for more oh wait its a big blade and it is razor sharp
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: spyderco endura
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother's birthday. I have an endura with the wave feature. The knife is lightweight and an excellent edc knife. I would highly recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Really nice knife!!
customer_reviews.text: I got his knife for my fiancée cause he always carries one. He loves it and said he wouldn't dream of carrying another knife. He finally has "the one".
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bayless

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight VG-10 blade totally awesome! Keeps a good edge... non slip handle... Good size blade... What more can I say...
customer_reviews.author: NEIL425

customer_reviews.title: really nice
customer_reviews.text: A lot lighter and slimmer than my previous edc knife. Feels very sturdy. Seems like a quality knife at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: guy who's reviewing

customer_reviews.title: hahahahahhaaa!!! gooood gooood gooood! fishing for ...
customer_reviews.text: hahahahahhaaa!!! gooood gooood gooood! fishing for hunting skinning and many more....ive got green one. ugly knife...as english bull terrier.
customer_reviews.author: nika

customer_reviews.title: A Little Surprised by all the Positive Reviews
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Sharp, light, nice size. Cons - ergonomics not that comfortable. Clip is really uncomfortable no matter which side I put it on....not sure why because they don't bother me as much on the Tenacious, Para-Military, etc....but on this it is really obtrusive. Also (and most importantly)...I am unable to flick this open like I can with my other Spydercos...I tried loosening the pivot screw a little but it still won't flick open...it is stiff.
customer_reviews.author: John

product_meta.title: Spyderco Endura 4 Lightweight Signature Folder Knife with 3.80" VG-10 Steel Blade and Green FRN Handle - PlainEdge Grind - C10FPGR
feature_bullets: FRONT-RUNNER - The Endura 4 sets the standard as one of the best-selling folding knives ever made. All members of the Endura 4 family include a four-position clip, a high-strength back lock mechanism, and Trademark Round Hole.

WIDE SPECTRUM OF HANDLE COLORS - Whether you enjoy bright colors or neutrals, our Endura 4 Flat Ground knives are designed to suit every taste. We offer Black, Blue, Green, Gray, Orange, Purple, Zome Green and Brown.

LIGHT AND DURABLE - This Endura handle is fabricated with Fiberglass Reinforced Nylon. FRN is a polymer mixed with glass fiber that is injection molded and formed into a sleek textured handle, creating a lightweight yet high-strength knife handle.
LOW FRICTION - This knife features a blade ground with flat bevels that extend from the spine all the way to the cutting edge. This grind reduces drag during cutting and decreases overall weight.

A SECURE GRIP - To provide a non slip grip, these knives are molded with our patented pattern, Bi-Directional Texturing. This texture pattern consists of opposing graduated steps radiating outward from the center of the handle.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars95 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
